DOC.HEAD: Radio, Broadway Actress Betty Garde Dies At 84
Eds: Retransmitting to correct cycle designator.
DOC.TEXT: Actress Betty Garde, who appeared in hundreds of radio plays and portrayed Aunt Eller in the original Broadway production of ``Oklahoma,'' is dead at 84. Miss Garde died Monday at a Sherman Oaks hospital, said Elliott Reid, a longtime friend. Born Katherine Elizabeth Garde in Philadelphia, the actress began her stage career in the early 1920s. She played character roles in Broadway productions such as ``The Social Register'' and ``The Primrose Path.'' In the 1930s she moved into radio, appearing in three dozen shows over the years, including ``The Eddie Cantor Show,'' ``Perry Mason'' and ``The Fat Man.'' She probably was best known as the wife of ``Lorenzo Jones'' and as ``Mrs. Wiggs of the Cabbage Patch.'' She worked on several Orson Welles radio specials and appeared regularly in the dramatic anthology ``Theater Guild on the Air.'' She had a few motion picture and television roles, notably as Wanda Skutnik in the James Stewart film ``Call Northside 777.'' Reid said she had no known immediate survivors.
